content.content: This forum post serves as notification for the return of 25 million Dai to MakerDAO from Genesis Global Trading, Inc. (GGT) regarding the second HVBank transaction. Notwithstanding having previously completed KYC/AML review for RWA Foundation and having completed a first DAI-USD conversion for RWA Foundation on Thursday, August 4, 2022, Genesis Global Trading, Inc. (GGT) has now determined that it is unable to undertake DAI-US Dollar conversions for RWA Foundation. As a consequence, the 25 million DAI transmitted to GGT on Saturday, August 6, 2022 will need to be returned to RWA Urn. This will require the MKR token holders to approve a change of the wallet address in the RWA Foundation portal with GGT from RWA Jar to RWA Urn. The following is the Executive text: If this Executive Proposal is passed The MKR token holders authorize The Director of RWA Foundation to instruct Ankura Trust Company, LLC to update the RWA Foundation portal with Genesis Global Trading Inc. by replacing 0x6C6d4Be2223B5d202263515351034861dD9aFdb6 with 0x1818EE501cd28e01E058E7C283E178E9e04a1e79 The Director of RWA Foundation to instruct Genesis Global Trading Inc. to return 25 million DAI to 0x1818EE501cd28e01E058E7C283E178E9e04a1e79 The Director of RWA Foundation to take such steps as are necessary to give effect to the above Ankura Trust Company, LLC to update the RWA Foundation portal with Genesis Global Trading Inc. to reflect the above changes to the RWA Foundation portal with Genesis Global Trading Inc.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an executive proposal explaining the return of 25 million Dai to MakerDAO from Genesis Global Trading, Inc. The proposal requires MKR token holders to approve a change of the wallet address in the RWA Foundation portal with GGT from RWA Jar to RWA Urn. The post does not contain any request for feedback, advertising, collaboration, or questions.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Thanks @monkey.irish! Chatted with PE and this seems doable to get inserted to the copy presently. Will be taking care of that and some coordination in the meantime, but expect to have an official call before too long.

content.content: If you are looking for an institutional OTC desk with whom you can convert DAI to USD (or vice-versa), I would love for RWA Foundation to consider working with Cumberland DRW. To introduce myself, my name is Paul Kremsky and I run business development for Cumberland.  Cumberland is the crypto arm of DRW, a principal trading firm coming from the TradFi side with about 30 years in various asset classes.  Cumberland straddles the world between institutional and crypto-native firms, and has some of the deepest OTC liquidity available. Let’s use this as an opportunity to start a conversation; if I can understand RWA’s needs, we can see if there’s a way for us to help.

I understand why the address must be changed to the Jar address, but why wasn’t this configured already as the Dai return address from the beginning? The Jar puts it into the Vow so this transaction is just counted as surplus, no? Does that mean there will have to be 25M DAI written off the original vault?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @g_dip @christiancdpetersen @williamr (and I’m sure many others) can correct me if I’m wrong. But my understanding is that this had to be amended because the funds were never intended to come back this way. The set up was designed solely for Genesis to trade DAI into USD and get those funds to HVBank, so with their recent cold feet (and restrictions of the trust agreements) the only way for us to get the funds back is to tell them where they need to send them.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: If I understand RWAUrn (the old address) correctly it could also be used to wipe the debt?

spin:  I understand why the address must be changed to the Jar address, but why wasn’t this configured already as the Dai return address from the beginning? The Jar puts it into the Vow so this transaction is just counted as surplus, no? Does that mean there will have to be 25M DAI written off the original vault?   The current address in the Genesis portal is the RWA Jar address (intended for receipt of DAI for the surplus buffer). To ensure that the 25 million DAI is returned to RWA Urn, RWA Foundation must change the current address in the Genesis portal. There was not a simple automated mechanism for RWA Foundation to distinguish between interest/fees (RWA Jar) and return of capital (RWA Urn) in the Genesis portal. So, the default address is RWA Jar. At the very end of the transaction, when RWA Master Participation Trust is closed and capital is returned, the intention is to change the wallet address at that time to RWA Urn. The Maker token holders will also have to approve that change. The above structure allows for current amounts of DAI to accrue to the surplus buffer.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: prose11:  But my understanding is that this had to be amended because the funds were never intended to come back this way. The set up was designed solely for Genesis to trade DAI into USD and get those funds to HVBank, so with their recent cold feet (and restrictions of the trust agreements) the only way for us to get the funds back is to tell them where they need to send them.   Correct, except for at the very end of the transaction when RWA Master Participation Trust is closed. Then “capital” will be returned to RWA Urn.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: christiancdpetersen:  There was not a simple automated mechanism for RWA Foundation to distinguish between interest/fees (RWA Jar) and return of capital (RWA Urn) in the Genesis portal. So, the default address is RWA Jar. At the very end of the transaction, when RWA Master Participation Trust is closed and capital is returned, the intention is to change the wallet address at that time to RWA Urn. The Maker token holders will also have to approve that change. The above structure allows for current amounts of DAI to accrue to the surplus buffer.   Exactly - what @christiancdpetersen detailed. Unfortunately, At Genesis it is only possible to hard code one destination address for sending DAI back to Maker. So it was initially set to reflect until termination of the Master Participation Agreement that all DAI sent to MD reflected fee and other income. Upon termination of the MPT, governance needs to issue an instruction to have all capital/principal repaid to the RWAUrn at which time the DAI debt in the urn can be wiped. Where ever we can we try to minimize manual steps - however this was deemed as necessary to enhance the security of the Real World Structure and ensure strict control for changing of wallet addresses.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
